page.title: 10The Royal Manor School
page.content: The schools in the Weymouth and South Dorset area underwent reorganisation with effect from 1st September 1985. Until that time Portland was served by one senior school for 600 pupils, Portland Secondary, with some children travelling daily to Weymouth to attend the Grammar School. With reorganisation came the Royal Manor Comprehensive School built to accommodate over 700 pupils. The Royal Manor School has many new buildings including an excellent sports hall, drama studio, library and purpose built music rooms and typing room. The old school building has been adapted to house new science laboratories and workshops for the Technical Studies department.
